member.name: T:Task1.Population
member.summary: This class helps to find how many years does the town need to see its population greater or equal to current population.

member.name: M:Task1.Population.GetYears(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method helps to count how much years must pass to get current population.
member.param: Amount of people, living in a town, at the beginning.
Rate of increase of the population.
New inhabitants per year, which came to live in the town.
Inhabitants of the town at the moment.
member.returns: Amount of years the town needs to see its population greater or equal to current population.
member.exception: Thrown when rate of increase is less than or equal to 0 or more than 100.
Thrown when initial population is less than 1 or current population is less than or equal to initial population or count of visitors is less than or equal to zero.
